reviews.review_msg: fair exams, explains concept well enough to understand the basics.

He's actually a solid prof, all the exam questions are from the practice behind textbook, and there is a youtube channel solving these questions. Overall his pace a lit bit slower than other prof lab is basically free mark you just follow the material. Exam grades come out fast 9/10

Majid is a good professor in terms of teaching. However, he gives way too much work. In his labs, he requires you to complete the lab itself, write a lab report, and perform a lab demo. In addition, you still need to do his hw assignments and study for his midterms. You won't have any free time considering how much work he gives you.
Some of the tutorials have been of limited use because Majid has provided the TAs with incorrect material on very short notice.

Likely the best professor in ENSC dept. High quality slides and encouraged questions from Majid ensure most students learn well. 5% bonus mark for participating. Class is test heavy but fair tests. Best way to learn is slide examples and HW review. Only downside is labs seemed a bit redundant. Scales to B- class avg. He is very fair and kind.

Basically a much harder 225. Homework and labs were much longer and more difficult than in 225. Steep learning curve for OrCAD, the replacement of LTSpice for simulation. Concepts get extremely difficult, but Majid explains it clearly that it makes sense in class. Allot lots of time for studying. Exams were fair but unforgiving if you do not study.
Majid makes difficult concepts easy to understand and often encourages students to ask questions which shows  his kindness. Show up to all lectures or you'll quickly fall behind.

Invites and answers questions, essential in a challenging course. Lectures can be boring but interesting with good understanding. Exams are fair with no tricks. The extra 10% project is appreciated. Labs are time-consuming; complete 60%-80% before class to finish on time. Practice A LOT, review assignments heavily. No part marks on exams.

After 252 last year, I was dreading taking another class with him. However, Majid has greatly improved as a professor. Quizzes, tests, and labs were all fair and generously marked. The only issue were the unscheduled mandatory lab sessions on Friday mornings for which I had to skip another class.

Majid went from being hated in ENSC252 in Fall 22' to becoming one of the greatest profs I've had. His explanations of concepts were always clear and it just clicks. However, you will still need to put in time practicing questions to do well in this class. Only downside is the lab sessions are chaotic and labs have unclear/wrong steps.

Majid is a nice guy. He has some bad habits like picking on students in class, not posting notes, or explaining concepts in ways difficult to understand. However, he is not bad at teaching and wants his students to succeed. I enjoyed the labs and tutorials by TAs were helpful. The quiz and exam averages were low 40s, but he scales nicely (to a B).

He is one of the best professors I ever had in Microelectronics. He has a great passion for teaching and excellent at teaching the material and is very good at getting concepts across. The lectures were great. The exams were very fair.

one of the best prof I've ever had. He is very willing to help during and outside of class. The course itself was hard enough, but he made it easy to understand by bringing real-life examples during the lectures.
Majid is a great prof! He is very willing to help during and outside of class. The course itself was hard enough, but he made it easy to understand by bringing real-life examples during the lectures.

Taken a class with him in the past and he has significantly improved. I have gained more respect for him over time as I found that he's very approachable and open to answering any questions or concerns you may have. Do not expect to understand everything on the first go of lectures. It's university and the concepts are hard. Allocate time to study.

Easily made my top 5 professor list. Despite the course difficulty, he made it very easy for me to understand. So much so that even his slides were enough for me when I started skipping class. His grading scheme was tough but tests were always fair. My only critique is that the labs felt very disorganized/not a major part of the course material.

Pros: Very caring, helpful and accessible outside of class. 2nd quiz was hard but exams were very fair overall. Hard class so he usually scales 2 letter grades.
Neutral: Labs were disorganized but that was more of the TA's responsibility then his.
Cons: Lectures sometimes get boring, but he's infinitely better then other ENSC profs

Difficulty was definitely 5/5 but, unless you put in absolutely no work he wouldn't fail you because he scales hard as he doesn't want students to fail. He is a caring prof and would recommend going up to him after class and ask questions if needed.
Majid is a very caring and knowledgeable prof in engineering Science. Excellent lectures.
Majid is a very knowledgable prof in engineering Science. Very good lectures.

Majid is s by far one of the most caring professors I have had. He is very helpful outside of the class even not on his office hours he is always ready to be helpful. He is very knowledgeable and relates the course materials with practical examples.

Majid is s by far one of the best and most caring professors I have had. He is very helpful outside of the class even not on his office hours he is always ready to be helpful. He is very knowledgeable and relates the course materials with practical examples.
He definitely got better as a professor, but his TA is an absolute joke.

Not the worst prof. He is a bit dry, but if you pay attention he's pretty helpful. Open to questions outside of class as well, and wants you to succeed. Don't be afraid to ask him questions - he's not as intimidating as he seems. To do well just redo assignment and tutorial questions.

Before I had Majid as my professor, I was told by every person who has taken a class with him to avoid him at all costs, but I refused to believe what my peers said. After spending half a semester with Majid, I understand what they meant and WILL NEVER be taking a class with him again.
Terrible Professor. Refuses to post lecture notes and can't explain topics to save his life

Very knowledgeable, Bring practical example into the class. I would recommend taking the course. He's very thorough in the notes. I would recommend attending lectures and starting the homework early. The homework is almost entirely based on notes or textbook.

Lectures were pretty much copy and pasted from the textbook. He would also call out students during lecture, often arguing with them. Overall, he came off kind of rude but was reasonable in his grading. The labs were a mess, sometimes we would go into a lab expected to do things we hadn't learned. Often times a fraction of groups finished on time.
Well, he's a good lecturer and is obviously very knowledgeable in the course material. I found him more approachable than the other two instructors I had this term.

Majid is an easy professor to talk to and is always approachable. Whenever in person, always makes time to get clarification on a topic, and would go through very detailed descriptions on not only the solution, but correlations towards real engineering discussions.
280 was OKAY. Wait till you take ENSC225 with him :)

I personally didn't enjoy his lectures. However, if you enjoy professors that don't clearly explain what they're teaching and is vague than you might like his lectures more than I did. His labs are strenuously long and aren't worth much of your grade and often have incorrect instructions. In general, his class structure is very poor but he's nice.

This guy stinks at teaching. He's incredibly boring, and it's obvious to see that he has 0 interest in what he teaches. The previous offering for 280 exposed you to R and a Matlab project. Nothing like that was to be seen this time around. Instead, we had the pleasure of calculating standard deviations for 30 data values for our exams...

Lectures are a copy paste of the textbook. All assignments and exams are pulled from textbook problems. I didn't find the content very engaging during lectures but he tries his best to involve students. Overall just a very average prof, nothing super great or bad to say. The class material is pretty easy if you take the time to do assignments.

Not a terrible prof, not the best either. Does go over derivations that textbook skips, and exams are pretty fair overall. However, is slightly disorganized and lectures were often a bit behind labs. Is very open to student suggestions, I requested extra office hours before an exam and he arranged for TAs to hold one. Responds well to emails.

Not great, lectures are copy-pasted from the textbook. Lectures are a waste of your time, just read the textbook on your own. Formulas are not always given. The class is annoying but not necessarily hard, but prepare to do most of the learning on your own.

Lectures are copy-pasted from textbook. Assignments are long and often given before material is covered. Labs are long, hard, directions are unclear and don't benefit your learning. Exams are hard and a ridiculous amount of your grade, formulas are often not given. Avoid taking him at all costs, and wait for another prof even if delays your degree.

Great and caring professor. Grades are based on 3 exams, assignments, quizzes, and lab experiments. ENSC225 is a new and tough subject for me, but he is one of the best to teach it so I certainly recommend him.

The professor gives us s fundamental understanding of pn junction, BJT, and MOSFET. It is beneficial to me for further study. Exams' difficulties are the same as the examples he is solving during the lecture times and assignments' questions. I highly appreciate this professor and his courses.

Professor majid is one of the best and most caring profs I have encountered at SFU, coming into classes he would make everyone feel welcomed with new slides for each lecture and always had an upbeat mood cracking jokes... has an odd fascination with fishes. His exams were easy and fair and always had enough material to review with textbook guides.

Honestly he's not a horrible lecturer but dear god. The labs are worth nothing compared to how much work they take. On top of that they are filled with unclear guidelines and I've gotten more help from other profs during the lab than Majid. He is still new but if he works this stuff out he would probably make a decent prof.

Terrible at explaining the core concepts of the course material, and regularly dodges questions about course material and concepts. Majid's labs are riddled with errors and refuses to fix these errors, instead expecting students to realize that the lab instructions as given will not lead to the desired result and ignore/alter the instructions.
Majid is a knowledgeable, caring and approachable lecturer. He is a great lecturer, and always has practical industry-related examples for the course materials (ENSC225).
Awesome prof, don't care about those comments bellow.

His lectures are taken directly from the textbook. It's honestly better to simply read the book than attempt to follow his lecture notes. The error riddled labs with their vague instructions also take an unacceptable amount of time considering how little they are worth for the class. These labs however are still mandatory to do, or else you fail.

Major's monotone voice and direct textbook copied slides make his lectures a drag to sit through. Use the textbook instead of lecture slides for future since he is prone to adding spelling errors in anything from a minor word that wouldn't impact understanding to a blatantly false formula every now and then.
